page.title: 11THE POLICE IN SOUTHWELL
page.content: A DAY IN THE LIFE OF POLICE SERGEANT MICHAEL PEAK On Sunday, 22nd September, the annual church service of the{Multiple {Sclerosis Society}was held in Southwell Minster. It has held here because it is the 25th anniversary of the Mansfield Branch of the Society. It was Sgt. Peak's job to keep the {traffic}under control, and to see that evrything went smoothly. A few hours before the service, Sgt. Peak briefed the{policemen}on duty and also the {Special Constables.} Special Constables are ordinary citizens who give their time voluntarily to help the Police. There main job this day was to keep the traffic moving away from the Minster for the arrival of the many coaches. The day passed without incident.
